meanings.definition: To hide or keep something secret
meanings.sent1: She tried to conceal her surprise when she saw the birthday cake.
meanings.sent2: The spy needed to conceal the top-secret documents from the enemy.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to conceal a rabbit in his hat.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed to conceal the sun, casting a shadow over the field.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map was cleverly concealed under a loose floorboard.

meanings.definition: To prevent something from being seen or known
meanings.sent1: He used his hand to conceal the answer during the test.
meanings.sent2: The dense fog would conceal the approaching ship from view.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to conceal his identity to solve the case.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the night concealed the movement of the mysterious figure.
meanings.sent5: The mask helped conceal her true emotions during the masquerade ball.
